passivePack

Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • passivePack.Inventory

  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines an inventory or backpack. An Inventory has a maximum capacity and only stores elements of type Loot.
    See Also:
    Loot

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Inventory()
      Constructs an inventory with a capacity of 10 weight units.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Loot loot)
      Adds loot to the inventory and changes the capacity accordingly.
      boolean contains(Loot targetLoot)
      Checks if the inventory contains targetLoot.
      Book getBook(int bookIndex)
      Gets a book by index from inventory.
      Book getBook(java.lang.String name)
      Gets a book by name from inventory.
      java.util.List<Loot> getBooks()
      Gets the books in inventory.
      int getCurrentCapacity()
      Gets the current capacity of the inventory.
      Key getKey()
      Gets a key from inventory.
      void remove(Loot loot)
      removes loot from the inventory and changes the capacity accordingly.
      void throwLoot(Room location, Loot loot)
      Removes the loot from inventory and adds it to location.
      java.lang.String toString() 
      void useKey()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Inventory

        public Inventory()
        Constructs an inventory with a capacity of 10 weight units.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentCapacity

        public int getCurrentCapacity()
        Gets the current capacity of the inventory.
        Returns:
        The current capacity.

      • add

        public void add(Loot loot)
         throws InventoryException
        Adds loot to the inventory and changes the capacity accordingly.
        Parameters:
        loot - The loot to be added.
        Throws:
        InventoryException - If there is not enough capacity.

      • remove

        public void remove(Loot loot)
        removes loot from the inventory and changes the capacity accordingly. If loot isn't in the inventory nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        loot - The loot to be removed.

      • useKey

        public void useKey()
            throws InventoryException
        Removes a key from the Inventory.
        Throws:
        InventoryException - If there is no Key in inventory.
        See Also:
        Key

      • throwLoot

        public void throwLoot(Room location,
             Loot loot)
        Removes the loot from inventory and adds it to location. If loot isn't in inventory then nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        location - The Room receiving loot.
        loot - The loot to be moved.

      • getBooks

        public java.util.List<Loot> getBooks()
        Gets the books in inventory.
        Returns:
        The books in inventory as a List.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Loot targetLoot)
        Checks if the inventory contains targetLoot.
        Parameters:
        targetLoot - The specified loot to be searched for.
        Returns:
        True if inventory contains targetLoot, else false.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getKey

        public Key getKey()
           throws InventoryException
        Gets a key from inventory.
        Returns:
        A Key in inventory.
        Throws:
        InventoryException - If no key is found in inventory.

      • getBook

        public Book getBook(java.lang.String name)
             throws InputException
        Gets a book by name from inventory.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the book.
        Returns:
        The book with corresponding name.
        Throws:
        InputException - If no book by name is found.

      • getBook

        public Book getBook(int bookIndex)
             throws InputException
        Gets a book by index from inventory.
        Parameters:
        bookIndex - the index of the book.
        Returns:
        The book with corresponding index.
        Throws:
        InputException - If the index is not found.
